body.name: BreathableBaby Breathable Mesh Liner for Full-Size Cribs, Classic 3mm Mesh, Gray Seersucker (Size 4FS Covers 3 or 4 Sides)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 15. Order within 5 hrs 34 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 15. Order within 13 hrs 58 mins
features: 3MM CLASSIC MESH WITH 85% LIGHT BLOCKING RATING: Constructed from 3 mm mesh with A.C.T. Air Channel Technology for unrestricted airflow. 100% polyester. 1" (2.54 cm) trim on top and bottom. Machine washable.

FITS FULL-SIZE STYLES WITH A 52" x 28" (132 CM x 71 CM) MATTRESS: Install long 11" x 111" (28 cm x 282 cm) and short 11" x 82" (28 cm x 208 cm) panels to cover 4 sides or only the long panel to cover 3 sides. Do not use on solid end styles or mini cribs.

SAFETY TESTED & TRUSTED: From BreathableBaby, the original breathable mesh liner with millions sold since 2002. Independently tested for safety to comply with ASTM F1917 for infant bedding. Contains no added chemicals, flame retardants or formaldehyde.

HELPS KEEP ARMS AND LEGS SAFELY INSIDE WITHOUT THE RISK OF RESTRICTED AIRFLOW: A single layer of breathable mesh allows exhaled air to pass through the fabric and mitigates risks associated with padded "crib bumpers" (banned in the US in 2022).

EASY TO INSTALL: Adjusts to fit with hook and loop. Tuck the bottom fabric trim below the top edge of the mattress and secure all fastenings before use. Review instruction manual and installation video or contact customer care for assistance.
body.description: At BreathableBaby, safety is first, last, and everything in between. That's why we have invested countless hours into medical and scientific research to make our products safer. We invented and perfected the breathable mesh liner. The original breathable mesh liner with millions sold since 2002.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2011
reviews.reviewText: If you are looking into this product, I am sure you are aware of the dangers of regular crib bumpers contributing to SIDS and suffocation. I had a regular bumper on my daughter's crib for a very short time and then became too worried and I removed it. I thought she would be okay without any bumper, but then she would wiggle to the side of the crib and her feet, although she was swaddled, would end up between the slats which would in turn wake her up. So I bought this bumper and I am so glad I did! It does have slight padding between two layers of mesh, so even though it is breathable, you will still get some protection from bumps. It is easy to install and uses velcro and a few ties and is adjustable to any crib. It goes down on the sides between the mattress and crib so it won't pull up or move around. The color is nice, too, and the satin edging makes it look more elegant...just mesh without the satin trim would look tacky. I am very happy with this purchase and have recommended it to other people as well! I really think this is a must have if you have a baby that moves around a lot. Even if you don't buy this, you really should not have a regular bumper in your child's crib, it just isn't worth the risk.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute and reliable
reviews.reviewText: I love how cute this is with my daughters crib, and makes me feel safer leaving her in her own room.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My 1 yo kept loosing his pacifier through the rails of his crib at night. Needed something to keep the pacifier inside the crib for him to easily find and allow us all to get a good nights sleep. This has worked perfectly. Easy set up but definitely read the directions or you’ll end up putting it on wrong and making it look weird.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2011
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Offers peace of mind
reviews.reviewText: My 4 1/2 month old has gotten herself caught twice in between the slats, once her arm and once her leg. She SCREAMED and needed "rescuing." I know it's not life threatening, but obviously uncomfortable and/or scary. When it was her leg she had red marks from pressing against the slat so hard. Babies don't know that they're not really stuck and can pull their limbs straight out. I didn't want a padded bumper since babies have suffocated against them. This bumper is great.Even though the instructions are for a solid crib (as drop-sides are now illegal), it's obviously still the same design for a drop-side. If they redesigned it then maybe they're wouldn't be so much layering where the two pieces come together. Then it may be slimmer and look nicer. But it works, and I'm grateful for the fact it exists and is fairly priced.If you follow the instructions, you actually don't have any gaps as one reviewer's photos show. It's solid all the way around.It is slightly padded for those worried about comfort. But honestly, I haven't seen any of my three babies care about smashing themselves up against the slats. :)My only problem with it is that the two ribbons that tie to the center slats on the front and back are sewn on with a simple straight stitch, and not a tight one at that. When I went to install it, one ribbon snapped off, with virtually no resistance. I was pulling it snug, as directed, and saw that it wasn't attached at the center where I had tied it. The ribbon was still tied, but had popped cleanly out from under the satin trim. No biggie. I was able to sew it (and put that ribbon in the back). But it could certainly be manufactured better. My husband was hesitant to use it at all after that, but I don't see it coming off again. The other side is holding just fine.Also, the instructions are difficult to follow. But in all fairness, I don't know how they could have explained it better. Assembly is confusing by nature of design of the bumper. It works the way it is, and I was able to figure it out with a little trial and error. A video would be more helpful than written instructions.I haven't had any problems as other reviewers described where the baby just pushes the bumper down and sticks their arms and legs out anyway. But then my girl is still very young. And she's also tall with long arms and legs, so smaller babies would be just fine too. I figure if she's old enough to where she does that, then she's old enough to pull her limbs back into the crib. As it is it is really very high and I don't see her being able to reach the top. Just make sure the bottom of the bumper is lined up with the top of the mattress, as you would normally attach any kind of bumper.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It is as advertised! It is very breathable and easy to install.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Safe and effective
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my son before transitioning him into his crib. He often wiggles his way up to the top corner of the crib and i never worry about suffocation due to the mesh composition of the bumper. He is comfortable and safe which allows me peace of mind.
